Sentencas: We report the use of a stable isotope oxygen ((18)O) labeling technique for the direct observation of oxygen/oxide ion motion at the cathode/interlayer/electrolyte interfaces in a practical flatten tube solid oxide fuel cells.
Titulo: Visualization of Oxygen Ionization and Flows in Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The trace of oxygen motion was labeled under a fuel cell reaction (current density of 0.25 A/cm(2) at 650 degrees C), and the (18)O incorporation and diffusion were visualized in a frozen state by secondary-ion mass spectrometry.
Titulo: Visualization of Oxygen Ionization and Flows in Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The active (18)O ionization and incorporation sites were the CeO(2) interlayer between the cathode and the electrolyte.
Titulo: Visualization of Oxygen Ionization and Flows in Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The higher (18)O concentration through the electrolyte was identified at the bottom of the cell (i.e., higher current density at bottom).
Titulo: Visualization of Oxygen Ionization and Flows in Solid Oxide Fuel Cells
